alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 03 at 1:30PM MDT until September 04 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... .Very dry air will move into the area on strong southwest winds Monday. Critical fire weather conditions may develop during the afternoon with above normal temperatures in the low to mid 90s. Winds will taper off Monday evening while temperatures cool and humidity rises. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) Monday afternoon and early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...12 to 17% * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
